body.p: Owen County, Kentucky, sheriff, court clerk, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Susan M. Black Ireland in Owen County, Kentucky, on February 26, 1851. Father of Sallie B. Ireland. Sheriff in Owen County in 1856. Court clerk in Owen County in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A.) as a captain from November 1862 to March 1863. Reported as deserted and capitulated to federal authorities in the summer of 1863. Found guilty by court martial of violating loyalty oath. Prisoner of war at Louisville Military Prison in Jefferson County, Kentucky, from July 26, 1863 to January 14, 1864. Transferred to Camp Chase in Columbus, Franklin County, Ohio on January 14, 1864. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government on October 12, 1864. Released from Camp Chase on October 12, 1864.
